name: unearth
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to discover something in the ground: Building at the site was halted after human remains were unearthed earlier this month.
to discover proof or some other information, especially after careful searching: A private detective has unearthed some fresh evidence.

to find something by digging in the ground: Artifacts more than 500 years old have been unearthed at the site.
unearth verb [T]
(DISCOVER)
to discover proof or other information, often after careful searching: Two amateur historians unearthed 570 documents with Mr. Lincoln’s signature by sifting through the files of the national archives.
